Summary Seasoned engineer and researcher on search relevance with hands-on development experience; project lead with major contributions spanning on machine learning ranking, relevance features, result set blending, search result presentation and query suggestions at leading search companies; Ph.D. on information retrieval and natural language processing with exceptional publication record in SIGIR and WWW. Specialties:Web search relevance, information retrieval, natural language processing Summary Seasoned engineer and researcher on search relevance with hands-on development experience; project lead with major contributions spanning on machine learning ranking, relevance features, result set blending, search result presentation and query suggestions at leading search companies; Ph.D. on information retrieval and natural language processing with exceptional publication record in SIGIR and WWW. Specialties:Web search relevance, information retrieval, natural language processing Experience Staff Software Engineer / Engineering Manager Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Boulder, CO I relocated to Colorado in 2014 to join my wife here. I'm now working on Google payments, tech leading and managing a team for automatic reconciliation of payments systems. Staff Software Engineer / Engineering Manager Google January 2010  –  December 2013  (4 years) Mountain View, CA I'm managing and tech leading the news quality team at Google. My team is responsible for headlines ranking for Google News and search ranking for news results in web search. Director of Search Relevance OneRiot September 2009  –  January 2010  (5 months) Building and managing the search relevance team for OneRiot, a real-time search engine which leverages social activities on the Web. 
 
During my short stay at OneRiot, I focused on laying down the foundations and roadmap for improving search relevance for the real-time web. 
 
1. Implementing new scoring scheme to improve the overall relevance for search results 
2. Laying down the framework for machine learning ranking functions 
3. Designing the query rewriting framework 
4. Improving user rank for social network activities 
5. Leading the efforts in standardizing editorial test for fresh results; designing and leading the implementation of editorial judging tools and query triage tools. Senior Relevance Scientist Yahoo! Inc. September 2007  –  September 2009  (2 years 1 month) Tech lead and researcher/engineer in core search relevance. Major contributions span on relevance features, machine learning ranking, search result blending and result presentation. 
 
1. Tech lead and main contributor for launching a new batch of text matching features to machine learning ranking functions for various markets; greatly improved the proximity of the search results. 
 
2. Lead and launched Yahoo answers and blogs machine learning ranking functions, and web search result blending in two major international markets; greatly improved user experience and search relevance. 
 
3. Search result presentation - launched static abstract strategy for specific categories of queries; query and document feature research for snippet ranking in summary generation. 
 
4. Co-inventor for 3 patents filed on search relevance. Software Engineer Google June 2006  –  September 2007  (1 year 4 months) 1. Major contributor to the launch of related search for simplified/traditional Chinese in 2006; lead the launch of related search for mobile search in Chinese. 
 
2. Implemented the search backend for the social network product in China; combining social network signals in object ranking 
 
3. Part of a research project for improving search relevance by applying more complex natural language analysis Engineering Intern Google Inc. July 2005  –  October 2005  (4 months) Worked with Dr. Vibhu Mittal; conducted research on sentiment classification in product reviews. Engineering Intern Google Inc. Banglore January 2005  –  April 2005  (4 months) Worked with Dr. Krishna Bharat; worked on named entity detection and short description extraction from news. Research Intern Microsoft Research Asia February 2001  –  June 2002  (1 year 5 months) Worked with Dr. Ji-Rong Wen; conducted research on applying user query log mining for query expansion, and structured document retrieval. Experience Staff Software Engineer & Tech Lead / Manager | Media Services Team Google January 2015  – Present (8 months) Kraków Area, Poland Rendering for Visual Effects (VFX) consumes XM core hours. It can be done on use Cloud. We provide them with the solution they can use, removing the need for the IT department doing the setup on Cloud themselves.  
 
Challenge lies in delivering easy to use tool for artists. She is already familiar with all the modeling applications and rendering solutions that exist on the market. Artist and small VFX companies are exposed to the complexity of Cloud, virtual machines with different specifications, different licensing mechanisms, with license servers failing under bigger load.  
 
Delivering solution that let artist send a rendering job to Cloud and forget about the rest 
 
Managing a team of 5 people. Responsible for end-to-end system, design and technical consultation, identification of technologies that can be further integrated into the system, making it magical for users. Focused on impact and removing obstacles to make the team deliver faster a great quality product. 
 
Technologies: GCE, Cloud SQL, Rendering software.  
 Staff Software Engineer & Tech Lead / Manager | Rollout Tools Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Kraków Area, Poland Automation of deployments, releases, monitoring and canary process. In the beginning, internally for Google Systems, later externalizing the concepts as a part of Google Cloud offering.  
 
Products needs to run reliably, regardless of machine, network, or data center failures. Production setup needs monitoring of services and persistent logging. Releases need to be handled without disruption to user traffic. We automate configuration of a service, maintenance and releases for you. 
 
I have joined the team as a Manager when initial version was launching. I have lead the team through the change from internal to Cloud and helped to reuse the domain knowledge to shape a new project for GCP. 
 
Technologies: Java, C++, Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

Summary I am a software engineer. I currently work on mobile and tablet apps, but I have done a lot of work on server side hosting and APIs. I am most happy as an Individual Contributor on a team building something cool, rather than taking on the role of planning, coordinating, or managing other people. 
 
I test the software that I build, I push back against unrealistic expectations, and I give thoughtful feedback on product design and features. That said, when a decision gets made, I execute it, even though I might not entirely agree with it. I am honest and direct, and can view feedback in the manner it was intended. 
 
And I get along with QA engineers really well. Summary I am a software engineer. I currently work on mobile and tablet apps, but I have done a lot of work on server side hosting and APIs. Experience Staff Software Engineer and Technical Lead Google January 2014  – Present (1 year 8 months) Designed and built the YouTube Kids application on Android, and currently I am working on the iOS application. Adding several features our users have been asking for, which makes me happy. Staff Software Engineer Google July 2012  –  January 2014  (1 year 7 months) Google[x] I worked on the applications you see when you use Google Glass, specifically real time video calls. This was all Android app work, with JNI and some lower level work in addition to the app itself. Senior Software Engineer Google August 2010  –  July 2012  (2 years) I worked on several projects here at YouTube, centered around the delivery of real-time video to consumers. I helped build the platform that streamed the 2012 London Olympics, and Hangouts on Air. This was a combination of Java and Python, generally as RPC services. Software Engineer Google October 2007  –  August 2010  (2 years 11 months) I worked on Google Groups, a small (by Google standards) but stable mailing list product. Got it to work for enterprise customers, helped build legal discovery tools, etc. Did a lot of operational improvements on it so that it didn't require as many engineers to keep it running. Maintenance work in C++ and python, new features developed in Java. Programmer Analyst III Center for Research in Biological Systems January 2007  –  August 2007  (8 months) Wrote a tool for parallelizing scientific applications. Finished my dissertation. Met cool people. Learned about MRI and medical imaging. Combination of Java, Perl, and Python. Graduate Student UCSD September 2001  –  August 2007  (6 years) Specializing in bioinformatics. Matlab, perl, R. Programmer Analyst III Biomedical Informatics Research Network 2007  –  2007  (less than a year) Worked on a tool for running many tasks in parallel on large clusters. Software Engineer Codexa Corporation January 2001  –  June 2001  (6 months) Designed a system for processing message board articles for financial signals, and then reselling those signals to institutional investors. It involved J2EE and message-driven beans before that was thing. Company had problems because message board articles tend to be posted by crazy people. All Java. On Sun hardware, even. Software Engineer New.net, Inc. 2001  –  2001  (less than a year) Let's be honest. Nobody but the employees remember this place. But, basically, they got it into their heads to create a DNS registrar that would handle top-level domains without the necessary standards-body approval, so you could buy "jones.family", and create a website for http://jones.family, but it could only be seen on the 20 or 30 computers that had some crazy browser plugin installed. 
 
Shortly after I left, that "browser plugin" started to do things like change your search engine, and is now widely considered to be spyware. "Senior" Server Engineer eMachines May 1999  –  December 2000  (1 year 8 months) Built a targeting popup ad server, an OOBE for Windows ME, an ad traffic system, and a bunch of other weird stuff. Emachines is still around in some form, but the division I worked for has long since evaporated. bottlewasher and haggler Free-PC/eMachines 1999  –  2000  (1 year) Mostly worked on MySQL databases designed with huge schemas, rather than taking a normalized approach and letting MySQL do its thing. 
 Portfolio Engineer First Quadrant 1997  –  1999  (2 years) Perl, lots and lots of perl. Experience Mobile App Search & Indexing - Engineering Manager, Tech Lead, Staff Software Engineer Google July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Mountain View, CA Manage a team to index, understand, and serve the content in mobile apps. Social Graph Service - Staff Software Engineer, Tech Lead Google January 2012  –  July 2014  (2 years 7 months) Mountain View, CA - The Social Graph Service provides a unified data model and API over all social graph data at Google. It is the central place for reading/writing membership data of G+ Circles, Hangout, G+ Communities, G+ Events and Google Voice, and reading user profiles. The service is a core component of several Google services including Google Plus, Hangout, and Google Voice. 
- As the Tech Lead of the Social Graph Core team, led a team of 5 engineers to develop the main system in Java on top of Spanner storage and ST index, and managed collaboration with clients to support new products and use cases. 
- Drove the design and implementation of the system for scalability (10+B user membership edges and 1M queries/second across 15 data centers), performance (under 12ms mean latency), consistency and client integration (70+ clients). 
- Personally wrote most of the system's backend serving layer and indexing solution. 
- Drove the migration of the system's storage from Megastore to Spanner, in the process significantly increasing the system's scalability (from 100 writes/seconds to 30+K writes/second) and consistency (full serializability). Completed the migration with zero system down-time or change to clients. 
- Led the launch of Hangout, G+ Communities and G+ Vanity URLs on Social Graph Service. Designed and implemented end-to-end indexing solution on top of ST index to support fast group chat lookup and various sorted views in Hangout client. Optimized the system's serving logic to reduce machine usage by 3X. Google Play Music - Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, Architect Google November 2007  –  January 2012  (4 years 3 months) Mountain View, CA - The Metadata Management Service handles the storage, relationship management, retrieval, and matching of 30+M tracks and the associated metadata. It aggregates the artist, album and track metadata from hundreds of music labels, and manages the complex relationship in the data. It facilitates the matching of all ingested music content, and powers core functionalities such as music search, Scan-and-Match of user uploaded content, and recommendations. 
- Architected the system end-to-end. Personally wrote the first version of the system in C++ on top of Bigtable storage. 
- Engineered end-to-end metadata matching system that matches raw content from music labels and user uploads to existing music store records. The system supports the re-ingestion and matching of the entire music corpus in under a day, and instant update of newly ingested content in under 2 hours. 
 
- The Music Store Service powers the search and browsing experience in the Google Play music store, and is the central business server for music search results, purchase fulfillment, manually curated content, and customer reviews. It serves 20+K queries/second, 100+K orders and $300+K revenue per day. 
- Built the service in Java on top of ST index (search results), Zipit (reviews), and Checkout (orders). 
 
- Led a team of 6 to develop the frontend service in Java and client music player in JavaScript. Drove product features and designs with product managers and UI designers. Web Suggest - Software Engineer III, Tech Lead Google September 2006  –  November 2007  (1 year 3 months) Mountain View, CA - Web Suggest is the feature that completes your query as you type in the search box. It started out as an experimental feature developed by 20% contributors. I was the first full-time engineer on the project. 
- As the Tech Lead of a 5-engineer team, productionized the system and graduated the product from experimental status. Drove the launch of the product in Asian markets (China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong). Achieved 25% feature adoption, increased average query length by 2%, and saved adopted users 48% keystrokes. 
- Using a Bayesian bigram model trained with query data in web logs, built the Chinese pinyin suggest feature that enabled Chinese users to input pinyin and get a list of matched Chinese character query completions. This greatly improved the search experience of Chinese users, allowing them to perform searches even when they do not have IME installed. Web Search - Software Engineer II Google October 2005  –  September 2006  (1 year) Mountain View, CA - Built using Python the Continuous Quality Evaluation Pipeline for CJK language segmenter to generate quality evaluation runs for quality experiments, and aggregate evaluation results. This enabled the evaluation, optimization, and ultimately the launch of Google's in-house CJK language segmenter that replaced the buggy and black-box third-party segmentation software we were using. 
- Implemented various web search frontend features including search query language encoding detection, and safesearch and results ranking twiddling for CJK queries. Our systems are serving billions of users across the globe as well as empowering teams across the organization. 
My satisfaction comes from observing my visions become reality step by step.

Summary Software Engineer, with several years of experience of leading engineering team working on tough technical problems at Google-scale.  
 
I am a Software Engineer and Tech Lead/Manager, focusing on products for Google users with a personal touch; personalized products which scale to millions of users (Classic examples. include recommendations, collaborative filtering, related items and accessories, etc.). 
 
All of my engineering career has been at Google - I have worked in Search Quality, Shopping, Display Ads, Search Ads Quality, Android (Market, now called Play), and Commerce.  
 
Additionally, I am using AI for the purposes of improving advertising: this is so called "computational advertising". I work closely with Product Management to create technology for new and innovative advertising products at Google. 
Before Google, I was a Research Scientist and Project Manager. 
 
Specialties: Large-scale Recommender systems 
User Targeting systems 
Machine Learning for User Data 
Data Mining for Advertising. 
Product Advertising. 
 
Some Products I've worked on:  
Product Search (Now Google Shopping): Related Products, Related Accessories, Shopping Home Page 
Android Market (Now Google Play): Related apps (Users who viewed, Users who installed), Top Lists, Trending Apps 
Google Books: Related Books 
Search Ads: Query rewrites 
Google Offers

Experience Staff Software Engineer, Tech Lead, Manager Google 2013  – Present (2 years) Kraków, Poland Lead a team of 8 engineers building a machine learning platform. Deployed as a collection of services behind a Web UI, the platform features model hosting, training, online and batch scoring, evaluation, and introspection, and supports binary­ and multi­classification models, and ranking models. The platform is used by several teams, and it is closely integrated with several production workflows. I have designed the system, and implemented one of the services (a training service). I have managed the project using Agile methods. I have lead collaborations with user and partner teams, in Mountain View and New York. 
 Staff Software Engineer, People Manager Google 2012  –  2013  (1 year) Kraków, Poland Managed an organization of 22 engineers, focused on advertiser acquisition. The org has built a range of tools and systems, from support systems used by Marketing & Sales, to prediction services, to handling promotional AdWords coupons. 
 
The latter is an externally­ facing service that handles redemption and fulfillment tracking of coupons, and it has been key in driving advertiser acquisition. I have co-­authored initial system designs, and later, managed the team in building and launching the system. I have coordinated integration of the system with Ads and Billing, negotiating timelines and driving between engineering, product, and business teams in Kraków and Mountain View. 
 Staff Software Engineer, Tech Lead, Manager Google 2010  –  2012  (2 years) Kraków, Poland Lead a team of 8-­10 engineers building an analytical SQL query service for large scale data warehouses. The system consisted of a query execution service and a rule-­based query optimizer. The execution service featured a novel evaluation engine, open-sourced at code.google.com/p/supersonic/, significantly out­-performing other similar solutions at Google. I have been an architect and a lead developer of Supersonic. Additionally I have lead an effort to increase reliability and scalability of the execution service. These efforts increased the maximum size of query-able data sets by 5x, yielded overall 30% performance gains end-­to-­end, and up to 5x speedup for a class of queries. 
 Senior Software Engineer Google 2008  –  2010  (2 years) Kraków, Poland As a Tech Lead / Manager, lead a team of 7-­10 engineers, building Google's resource utilization monitoring infrastructure. I have been a lead designer of foundational service interfaces that allow Google infrastructure services, owned by various distributed teams, to uniformly report their quota and usage data. I have negotiated the interfaces with infrastructure teams, and brought ~10 initial services on board. 
 
I have lead and largely implemented a MapReduce-­based data aggregation pipeline, designed a datacube schema, and lead the team in delivering a reporting solution, serving parametrizable resource utilization reports in UI dashboards. 
 Software Engineer Google April 2007  –  2010  (3 years) Kraków, Poland Implemented a monitoring agent that collects and reports resource usage data (CPU, RAM, etc.) by production tasks, at 1s resolution. As of 2015, this agent still runs on every production server. Co-designed a distributed data collection and aggregation system, gathering fleet­-wide compute usage data with less than 15 minutes latency. 
 Research Associate Emory University Department of Math and Computer Science 2000  –  2007  (7 years) Atlanta, GA, USA Co­-authored three research proposals funded by US National Science Foundation and US Department of Energy.  
 
Contributed to the Harness project, joint with Oak Ridge National Labs and University of Tennessee, designing and implementing high performance computing frameworks for compute-intensive applications. 
 
As an architect and technical lead of the H2O project, managed a group of 4­-5 researchers developing an experimental Java-­based distributed component framework for scientific computing. Pivotal Systems provides products that solve some of the toughest yield and throughput plasma etch and deposition challenges in high-volume manufacturing.
